item.title: Report I-2024110076
item.description:
Report I-2024110076

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-28T06:19:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-20
  • City: Miami
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: AMERICAN AIRLINES AMERICAN EAGLE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Outbound flight AA1646 MIA-DFW at Gate D8 had a shipment that was refused due to a DG-related issue. CC called to report that they had a DGD at the gate, but there was no NOTOC. I instructed CC to refuse the cargo and ensure the shipment is not loaded. I sent Tim to the gate, and he confirmed that, in addition to the freight containing batteries, one of the pieces was labeled for cargo aircraft only. This is an undeclared DGD from the shipper, if you noticed in these photos, the ramp broke down the skid which contained the hidden Dangerous Good

item.title: Report X-2024100715
item.description:
Report X-2024100715

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-25T12:24:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-04
  • City: DEFUNIAK SPRINGS
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Package was completely destroyed. Package burned only thing left are 120 lithium battery cells. Undeclared package, no hazmat markings or labels no OP-900. Package was lithium batteries that were mishandled. The batteries failed and caught fire. Resulting in fumes/smoke and an evacuation that lasted around 25 minutes. The sort resumed after the fire department cleared the affected area. There are no markings or information on this package left after the fire department put the fire out. was reported to NCR.
